issue.title: Problem connecting to server during setup

content.raw:
*updated 2017.01.09*

Before doing any of the following I performed a clean install following every step on the wiki, *and* I did the following
```
#!bash
sudo update-alternatives --config java
sudo update-alternatives --config javac
```
selecting the java8 version.

I then tried to run the pre-compile commands for the ihmc controller.  

If that still doesn't help, so I went ahead and just tarball'd every file on my image that had "ihmc" in it.  They are all available [here](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B1FRoSyfzOyhcTNnQ2lCZWduWXc?usp=sharing), named with the path they should extract to.  I have no idea if this will work at all but I figured it somehow worked for me, maybe it can help others get back to doing robotics instead of futzing with sysadmin issues.

**original post**

Had the problem as well, but fortunately I still had an image of a system where I got this step to successfully run.  The files are stored in the gradle cache in your home directory.

Go ahead and grab this [tarball](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1FRoSyfzOyhekg3UWZTd1g4bkE/view?usp=sharing) that I made.  

Then:

```
#!bash
mv Downloads/gradle.tar.gz ~/
cd ~/
tar -xvzf gradle.tar.gz
```

This will fill your gradle cache (in ~/.gradle) with the necessary files for the following to work:

```
#!bash
source /opt/nasa/indigo/setup.bash
roslaunch ihmc_valkyrie_ros valkyrie_warmup_gradle_cache.launch
```

updated 2017.01.09

Before doing any of the following I performed a clean install following every step on the wiki, and I did the following

sudo update-alternatives --config java
sudo update-alternatives --config javac

selecting the java8 version.

I then tried to run the pre-compile commands for the ihmc controller.

If that still doesn't help, so I went ahead and just tarball'd every file on my image that had "ihmc" in it. They are all available here, named with the path they should extract to. I have no idea if this will work at all but I figured it somehow worked for me, maybe it can help others get back to doing robotics instead of futzing with sysadmin issues.

original post

Had the problem as well, but fortunately I still had an image of a system where I got this step to successfully run. The files are stored in the gradle cache in your home directory.

Go ahead and grab this tarball that I made.

Then:

mv Downloads/gradle.tar.gz ~/
cd ~/
tar -xvzf gradle.tar.gz

This will fill your gradle cache (in ~/.gradle) with the necessary files for the following to work:

source /opt/nasa/indigo/setup.bash
roslaunch ihmc_valkyrie_ros valkyrie_warmup_gradle_cache.launch
